Good sensitivity. Flow analysis (degree of stenosis). Measurement of resistance indexes (predictive of response to treatment). |Obese subjects. Radiologist's experience. |- |'''Spiral computed tomography'''' |Direct visualisation of the renal arteries (trunk + dividing branches). Demonstration of calcifications. Good definition |Large quantities of iodinated contrast products (renal toxicity). Irradiation. |- |'''Angio-MRI'''' |Direct visualisation of the renal arteries. No renal toxicity (gadolinium). |More restricted access. Overestimation of lesions. |- |Renal arteriography |Reference examination. Diagnostic and therapeutic interest. |Iodine injection (renal toxicity). Cholesterol crystal emboli. |}

question.title: What is a limitation of Spiral Computed Tomography (CT) for diagnosing renal artery stenosis?
question.description: Which of the following is a limitation of Spiral Computed Tomography (CT) for diagnosing renal artery stenosis?

option_a.title: Radiologist's experience
option_a.description: The level of expertise required to interpret the images

option_b.title: Large quantities of iodinated contrast products (renal toxicity)
option_b.description: The risk of kidney damage due to the contrast agent

option_c.title: Irradiation
option_c.description: The risk of radiation exposure to the patient

option_d.title: Overestimation of lesions
option_d.description: The risk of misdiagnosing the extent of the stenosis

correct_option.title: Large quantities of iodinated contrast products (renal toxicity)
correct_option.description: The risk of kidney damage due to the contrast agent
